result.execSummary:
The defendant Shakira M King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution in the amount of $984.00 to be paid to Kohl's Corporation as a condition of probation.
7/31/2017:  Court modified restitution to $484.00 to be paid to Kohl's Corportation as a condition of probation.
Costs/DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation.

No contact with stores listed in complaint and co-actor listed in complaint.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Shakira M King in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to Count #2, Count #1 is dismissed and read in. Court finds the defendant guilty of Count #2. State makes recommendations. Atty. Weathers makes statements. Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #2

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

45 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - TBD days).  STAYED.

Term of Probation: 1 Year (If all costs and restitution are paid, probation will end at 6 months)

Conditions of Probation:

-Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
	
-No contact with stores listed in complaint and coactor listed in complaint.

-Maintain/Obtain full time employment;

Condition Time: 5 days Huber with  NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion

Restitution: $984.00  to be paid to Kohl's Corporation as a condition of probation

COSTS:  $253.00    to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Surcharge: $200.00  to be paid as a condition of probation

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 20, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Motion to forfeit bail granted.

Defendant Shakira M King in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Weathers makes a Motion to dismiss for failure to state a claim. Arguements presented by the State objecting to the dismissing of the case. Court denies the Motion to dismiss the complaint. Court proceeds with the Preliminary Hearing. Detective David Gawrisch from the City of Waukesha, sworn in and testified. Cross examination by Atty. Weathers. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. Testimony closed. State moves for bind over. Closing statements presented by Atty. Weathers.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 10:00 am.
